subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP--Ann
author: Lisby
full_text:
Sending out a mental message can't possibly hurt. I suspect they can  
find you wherever you go. I'm rooting for you!

Ann

On Feb 12, 2008, at 6:22 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:

>
> Ann, I'm seeing this post two weeks after it was sent but wanted to  
> thank you for the pep talk.  I need it!  The DVD remote makes me  
> cry too..  I just can't understand why everything has to be so  
> complicated and why my kids and husband don't have the problems I  
> have.  I've been carrying my two hacked radios and digital recorder  
> everywhere with me but have not sat down to seriously attempt a  
> session yet.  I work three days a week out of state and tonight am  
> planning to camp out in my car in a remote place so I can really be  
> alone with the equipment.  Do you think it would help for me to  
> send out verbal or mental messages that I'm hoping to make contact  
> but don't know where I'll be yet?
>
> Robin
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Lisby
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2008 4:44 PM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP
>
> Robin, you can do it. It took me ages and about $900, but I finally  
> got it all together and its running well. I am a technical as an  
> onion. I can't operate the DVD remote without tears. But I hung in  
> there--and you must, too. This is a massively rewarding experience  
> and I can't wait to see what you get and who you get it from. :)
>
>
> Ann
>
> On Jan 30, 2008, at 7:03 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:
>
>>
>> Thanks LC.  I'm going to listen to your recordings tonight when I  
>> get home.  I'm intrigued by the box research and anxious to get  
>> started, but frustrated that I'm not mechanically inclined.  I  
>> think you may be onto something with regard to people having  
>> individual roles to play, and you must feel so inspired by the  
>> messages you've received.
>>
>> Robin
>>
>>
>> ----- Original Message -----
>> From: LC Duplatt
>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>> Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2008 6:37 AM
>> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP
>>
>> Robin,
>>
>> I uploaded some of my recordings that indicate a bigger picture.
>>
>> Some of the messages say there are "many spirits here," spirit rescue
>> is "very important," etc. You can go through them under LC's folder.
>>
>> Last Friday, I recorded with respect to 2008, "psychic event"
>> and "universal shift." That would indicate that there is a bigger
>> thing going down, in my opinion. However, I also acknowledge that
>> people here may have different callings/messages/uses other than what
>> I am hearing. I am going to just follow where the path before me
>> leads and try to find my role in it.
>>
>> Personally, I think this needs to be in many people's hands. That's
>> an interest of mine, too. Not sure yet how it will happen, but the
>> radio hacks are a nice start.
>>
>> LC
>>
>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Robin Searcy Henson"
>> <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
>> >
>> > I haven't started box recording yet. My impression of the EVP I've
>> captured (which has been almost entirely obtained on the property I
>> moved to six years ago) is that someone is attached to this place.
>> The first message was "Here come some people," as I was hiking up the
>> hill one day with my goats, then a kill-you threat in the house,
>> then "get out of here" in the barn. I assumed it must be one of the
>> original owners, and I still feel that it's mainly one spirit
>> communicating that this is their home, not mine. I've gotten one
>> uplifting message from what I believe to be the same entity, and this
>> is also the last recording I've gotten. I asked what death is like,
>> compared to life: happy, beautiful, fulfilling--and specifically if
>> death is less depressing. The response was "It's everything."
>> S/he/it basically stopped talking after that, and I stopped trying.
>> I know this sounds weird, but I miss whoever or whatever it was. I
>> wonder if some of us might be better at dealing with the low-life
>> stuck or grounded entities rather than the highly evolved technicians
>> coming through the more sophisticated equipment. I wonder where this
>> is all going ultimately, other than to prove communication across the
>> veil is possible. I'm not an engineer or technologist on this
>> physical plane, and I question what I have to offer this research
>> since I'm so electronically challenged. Meanwhile, the nurse side of
>> me wants to heal and "fix" anyone needing help, even if they happen
>> to be in the next world! Do the guides and technicians ever
>> acknowledge or make reference to the earthbound spirits, and if so,
>> in what context? Are we ever able to help unstick the stuck ones?
>> Are we supposed to ignore them?
>> >
>> > Robin
>> >
>> >
>> > ----- Original Message -----
>> > From: LC Duplatt<mailto:lcdupla@...>
>> > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
>> > Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 2008 3:32 AM
>> > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP
>> >
>> >
>> > EVP:
>> >
>> > Not that this is always the case, but EVP seems to primarily
>> capture
>> > lost people - ghosts being recorded, versus the box having the
>> > ability to capture primarily what seems to be higher
>> communication
>> > from spirits, (and less of the lower communication - ghosts
>> jumping
>> > in).
>> >
>> > That to me is a huge difference... ;)
>> >
>> > LC
>> > http://www.AngelsGhosts.com<http://www.angelsghosts.com/>
>> >
>> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%
>> 40yahoogroups.com>, "ecuyler" <ecuyler@> wrote:
>> > >
>> > > I agree about the difference also. All that review time makes
>> for a
>> > > very tedious few hours. By the end of it you're ready to pull
>> your
>> > > hair out. I've only done two sessions now and have gotten more
>> > > positive results in 20 minutes time as I have in 10 years of
>> EVP
>> > research.
>> > >
>> > > Jeremy
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > >
>> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%
>> 40yahoogroups.com>, Lisby <lisby@> wrote:
>> > > >
>> > > > Very interested. And I agree with you about the overnight
>> > change.
>> > > > Orgs like AA-EVP that aren't dealing with the boxes are
>> missing
>> > the
>> > > > boat.
>> > > >
>> > > > Ann
>> > > >
>> > > > On Jan 28, 2008, at 8:48 PM, Jules wrote:
>> > > >
>> > > > > Well guys, I have to tell you that since I started box
>> sessions
>> > in
>> > > > > November I have become so spoiled that conventional EVP
>> just
>> > don't do
>> > > > > it for me.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > My organization was asked to come and do an investigation
>> at a
>> > very
>> > > > > historial place (here in Illinois). The owner of this home
>> > asked if I
>> > > > > would bring one of the boxes to the home (he is amazed with
>> the
>> > > > > immediately 2 way communication). So upon respectfully
>> asking
>> > my tec
>> > > > > if it was alright to do a session outside the my home we
>> did
>> > several
>> > > > > box sessions along with conventional EVP. We wanted to see
>> if
>> > we could
>> > > > > discover some unanswered history about the residence, and
>> the
>> > > > > otherside
>> > > > > was more than willing to comply.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > I have to tell you that the regular EVP recordings were and
>> are
>> > the
>> > > > > most boring data to review. Something I use to love so much
>> has
>> > > > > actually turned into a project given I am waiting for a
>> response
>> > > > > immediately! Too funny how things can change overnight!
>> > > > >
>> > > > > I will be uploading some files for these sessions if you
>> are
>> > > > > interested.
>> > > > >
>> > > > > Juli
>> > > > >
>> > > > >
>> > > > >
>> > > >
>> > >
>> >
>>
>>
>>
>
>
>
>
